meanings.definition: A device used to measure the gradient of a physical quantity.
meanings.sent1: The scientist used a gradiometer to find the slope of the hill.
meanings.sent2: The gradiometer helped determine the rate of change in temperature.
meanings.sent3: The gradiometer decided the steepest slide in the playground.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition acted as a gradiometer, sensing the subtle shifts in mood.
meanings.sent5: The gradiometer beeped loudly as it detected the incline of the road.

meanings.definition: An instrument that detects changes in a magnetic field.
meanings.sent1: The gradiometer indicated a shift in the magnetic field.
meanings.sent2: Using the gradiometer, they located the source of the magnetic disturbance.
meanings.sent3: The gradiometer at the museum went crazy near the ancient magnet.
meanings.sent4: His mind was like a gradiometer, picking up on the smallest magnetic variations.
meanings.sent5: The gradiometer hummed softly, signaling the presence of metal nearby.
